channel.title: Keylogged? Help me pl0x?
channel.description: Sorry about the title but I do need a little tiny weeny bit of help. I recently discovered some Spyware installed a programme called 'Watchdog.' Either my dad or spyware installed this. I'm pretty sure it is a keylogger as it runs secretly and can only be terminated when in Task Manager. I tried to remove the programme through Control Panel but it sin't even on there. Can someone tell me how do destroy it? I have run about 5 virus removers and one seem to pcik it up.

item.title: Keylogged? Help me pl0x?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

i said it was a valid process when i was talking about "my dad downloaded it for security reasons"

but it's a pain in the neck to remove it. lol.

item.title: Keylogged? Help me pl0x?
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Ahh, Ok I better leave it there for security then

Thanks again Ron - Looks like I better give you more rep. If you have MSN I would be extremely happy if I could add you

His Apple is expensive, lol. It is really really nice too

Just asked my dad about it and it turns out he installed it

My bad guys. Thanks again for your help Swift and Ron

Read full topic

item.title: Keylogged? Help me pl0x?
item.dc:creator: @Swift Swift
item.description:
@Swift wrote:

Lol, no. They just want you to use their product.
Wintask won't do anything.

Look:

Watchdog.exe is a process belonging to the Kwakkelflap Watchdog-O-Matic. This product monitors critical applications and handles crashes. This is not a critical system process however it should not be terminated unless causing problems.

http://www.processlibrary.com/directory/files/watchdog/

Read full topic

item.title: Keylogged? Help me pl0x?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

hey, it's not spyware at all man. My dad said he downloaded it because it's for security reasons. But he said in quote "Don't download that fucking program, it took me 5 days to remove that fucker, look you lil shit i dont need any more trouble. ill wipe you with the floor if you ask me for something like that again you lil prick."

Aww... My dad. lol

Still looking for removal. Don't worry, it's there somewhere. lol dont do the apple thing man, apple comps are too expensive. :)[br][size=1]Posted at: April 30, 2006, 06:34:53 am[/size][hr]FOUND IT!!!

http://www.liutilities.com/products/wintaskspro/processlibrary/watchdog/

scroll down to remove it. Says to dl wintasks and thats what removes it.

Read full topic

item.title: Keylogged? Help me pl0x?
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Thanks mate. I have looked for it through Google but never get anywhere. All it comes up with is the programme 'Watchdog.'

I have a feeling it is a self installed keylogger which maybe my dad put in to monitor me. If I find out it was him, I'll install a virus on his Apple.

Read full topic

item.title: Keylogged? Help me pl0x?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Hmm.. What's the Spyware called, exactly?

You can google it, and you can get the manual uninstallation of the pyware by goign into regedit and deleting its registry entries and deleting any files it has created. Ill look for watch dog though. be back soon.

Read full topic

item.title: Keylogged? Help me pl0x?
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Thanks Ron, but unfortunatly, I have ran that programme and updated it and it never picked it up I'll find some way to get rid of it. It is just a bit if a nuisance because I have to change my Rs passes when I forget to terminate it.

Read full topic

item.title: Keylogged? Help me pl0x?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Run Spybot Search and Destroy

Update it fully and then immunize. Get off the internet, and then run spybot and delete everything it finds. Good luck.

~Ron

Read full topic
